website_summaries.verdict: A flavorful, nutritious, meaty, and exotic quail pate featuring a blend of natural ingredients and fortified with additional vitamins and minerals.
pros: Quail, chicken, liver, and fish, are the first 4 ingredients
Healthy ingredients like carrots, quail broth, and eggs
cons: Not for cats trying to avoid poultry due to allergies

customer_reviews.title: Made my cat throw up
customer_reviews.text: We just switched to Purina and my cat has thrown up twice from eating this. We thought it was because he’s not used to the food or ate too quickly, so we gave it to him in smaller portions, then we found this while cutting up the food. A plastic string about the length of my index finger inside the food! I don’t know if it’s just this batch but it makes me question the quality of the entire Purina Beyond line.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Bad Batch!
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying to switch my cats over to a better quality cat food and so far this is the one they have done the best on; however when I opened up my third box today, I was disgusted to find leaking cans and maggots! I wish I could take a picture of the horrific smell, as well. I had set this up as a monthly reorder, but will change my mind if they don't replace this spoiled batch. This is the first time I have ever purchased wet cat food and had spoiled product :(
customer_reviews.author: KMason

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Missy Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: I was paying a lot for another high quality brand. Then I found this. I looked over the ingredients several times before I agreed this too is good cat food. No by products, no grains, no artificial colors or flavors. Less then what I was paying for the other brand plus I like having it delivered to my door.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne

customer_reviews.title: Finally a healthy canned cat food that none of my cats throw up!
customer_reviews.text: Please offer all varieties of the pate in this newest brand. I stumbled upon this new Purina canned cat food at Kroger, but I prefer to order on a subscription service with my Amazon Prime. I have 4 cats of varying age and digestive tolerances so I am really picky in feeding them healthy food without all the artificial ingredients and preservatives. I don't buy the versions with gravy because they would only eat the gravy and leave the food, but all of them loved the pate flavors. They also really like the dry versions of Beyond cat food.
customer_reviews.author: BARBARA GALE WELLS

customer_reviews.title: Food is good, but BEWARE CONTAMINATED CANS
customer_reviews.text: So far, I've been ordering this food with very little issue; my cat likes it and she maintains a healthy weight. HOWEVER: be sure to check your food before feeding it. The food has some gel around the inside of the container, as is typical with pates. However, I've received an order of cans where the food was darker than normal, had a strong, gross smell, and there were black/grey cloudy particulates in the gel, similar to a mold. SCRUTINIZE THE FOOD BEFORE FEEDING- I had to run to the store to get single replacement cans, and upon opening them and comparing they were a brighter color of pate and there was no dark cloudiness in the gel.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Stambaugh

customer_reviews.title: Multiple orders are shorted
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally place negative reviews, especially since my cat lives on this stuff; but I have had to contact seller/amazon on multiple orders now where I have been shorted cans. The description clearly states 2 packs of 12 cans (24 total), and I have ordered this many times with no issues. Lately I have been recieving only ONE case of 12, which doubles the cost and shorts me food for my cat that needs the grain-free food that the local store refuses to carry. If they can stop shorting me boxes and having to fix the orders, I'd gladly give a more positive, even 5 star, review.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Induced projectile vomiting in my cat
customer_reviews.text: My cat has been eating this for awhile but the last two boxes I received have given her projectile vomiting and that ruined my floors. I won't be purchasing this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: I feed my cat a mix of wet and dry food. I usually buy wellness formula grain free but it's expensive so there are a few other brands I'm willing to sub out including this brand. My cat Marley has ibs-d and c. So a lot of foods can cause either smelly diarrhea that stinks up my place or constipation that gets so bad she refuses to eat and vomits everywhere. It's terrifying when it happens, but I've found a good combo of food. She does half a can morning and night of this, and like 6 Tbsp of senior formula or weight management formula. She's happy and is constantly screaming for more of her fav food. 😅
customer_reviews.author: B. laurenson

customer_reviews.title: Great cat food
customer_reviews.text: Great cat food. This is something to try if your cat has IBS or IBD. Apparently, the irritant is frequently the grains the cat food companies mix into the food formulations to cheapen the costs of manufacturing. Here is one which is reasonably priced, very palatable to cats and has resolved, for my cat, a very difficult and painful intestinal problem. Well worth the cost given the improvement in my cat's health.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Healthier than average.
customer_reviews.text: I tried many “natural” cat foods and this one seams to have a good balance of price and quality. Some more expensive brands has good list of the ingredients but poor quality control and the food smells awful or has sharp bones in it. Purina Beyond smells like normal cat food, has smooth texture and our cats like several types of it. No carrageenan in most of varieties.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more buying wet cat food from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: My cat will eat the same food from the store but not Amazon. I've tried several different types. I get them at the grocery store and he eats them... Amazon...he will not eat it. Something is happening to the wet food at Amazon. My only guess is that it's getting too hot either in storage or shipment. I watch for the delivery so I know it's not at my end. I've wasted a lot of money. The data on the food was good.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: My picky cats liked it
customer_reviews.text: My cats are picky! They won't eat anything pâté and sometimes won't eat super chunky either. This fit the bill and they liked it. I can't attest to taste because I'm not a cat, but I'm assuming it was delicious as they ate it and looked for more. This isn't going to break the bank and perhaps your cats will like it. Or maybe not, cats are weird.
customer_reviews.author: Chimney161Top Contributor: Minecraft

customer_reviews.title: Cat got hives
customer_reviews.text: We've been loyal to the purina brand for a long time (Even though I loathe nestle), as it's one of the few brands my cat likes that isn't the equivalent of mcdonalds or cost an arm and a leg. She's 9 years old and she's never ever had an allergic reaction before, so I'm hesitant to call it that. This appears to have happened with both the trout and salmon flavors of wet food. I'm reluctant to feed her anything else in the variety case I ordered. Keep an eye out for recalls before ordering this item, and only order in small quantities at first, if at all.
customer_reviews.author: Baba Yaga

customer_reviews.title: Where’s The Gravy?
customer_reviews.text: This Is The First Beyond Wet Food That Mysterio And MJ Are Disappointed!! There’s Virtually No Gravy!?! It’s Just Moist To Almost Dry!!
customer_reviews.author: Dan The Man, The Marshmallow Man

customer_reviews.title: Our cat is obsessed with this food.
customer_reviews.text: We had been using a different kind of wet cat food to round out our older cat's diet; the dry food wasn't enough, so the vet recommended adding a can of wet every day, but the kind we had been using was affecting her skin. So, we tried this kind. Now, we have a junkie on our hands—the cat is addicted and has become obnoxiously insistent on having this cat food available at all times. So, I'm guessing the flavor is 5 stars—I'm not gonna try it to verify, though, and the cat isn't speaking to me until I put another can out for her.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory R. Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it
customer_reviews.text: My two senior cats love this. In fact, when I ran out they left the other food untouched until I finally ran to the store at night to buy more. One of mine has no teeth (a rescue who came to me that way), and she seems to like the consistency better. It is definitely nice and soft and moist. I love the fact that it's organic and good quality protein for them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cats Don't Seem To Like It As Much As They Once Did . . . .
customer_reviews.text: This month, I thought I would buy this Purina Beyond canned food and save some money, instead of theI often get for my cats. They ate this before I ever bought the Simple Origins. For some reason, however, they sometimes would not finish off many of the cans in this 24 can box set, something that never happens with the Simple Origins. So, I won't order again. P.S. Another Purina Beyond my cats always eat without fail is the. They would like the more expensive canned food best. :)
customer_reviews.author: SundayAtDusk

customer_reviews.title: Simple and great solution plus steroids and cerenia for nausea
customer_reviews.text: My 13 year old cat has had inflammatory bowel disease for years with chronic vomiting and allergic reaction to any cat foods she likes. After spending a fortune on vet rx foods, I found this one at the local grocery store. She loves it and no more vomiting! Some skin allergy but tolerable. Am so grateful she and I are so happy!
customer_reviews.author: None

customer_reviews.title: Great NON-GMO Food - My Kitties Love It!
customer_reviews.text: My kitties love this. Plus it is NON-GMO, so there is no glyphosate. All GMO and nonorganic food contain glyphosate which the World Health Organization has indicated is a DEFINITE cause of cancer in animals. So I am very happy to find this food! Thank you, Purina.
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, substitute for Halo brand
customer_reviews.text: Hi! My lil girl was on a strictly Halo brand diet since I got her. She eats both the wet and dry food each day. At exactly a year she simply turned her nose up at the Halo wet food in any flavor. The dry she still loves. But what to do? Of course she likes Nutro brand, but it’s way too expensive. This Purina Beyond is healthy, tasty and affordable. So glad she’s eating her wet food again Yay Beyond chicken, sweet potato, & spinach!
customer_reviews.author: Nonya

customer_reviews.title: Sensitive kitty gives thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: My lil boy doesn't do well with a lot of foods that have gluten and grains and soy and the list goes on. We do give him little pieces of tortilla but some wet foods with gluten in it make him vomit and give him diarrhea for days. We were giving him Instinct and Nulo exclusively until we couldn't afford it anymore. These have been an awesome affordable replacement. No signs of upset tummy after a few months.
customer_reviews.author: David Lair

customer_reviews.title: He will eat only enough dry food to not starve if he doesn't like it. This brand he loves
customer_reviews.text: I have a very picky cat. He won't eat most cat treats. He will ONLY eat 'in gravy' wet foods. He will eat only enough dry food to not starve if he doesn't like it. This brand he loves. His vet wanted him to put on a few pounds and I went on a hunt for something he actually likes. He loves their dry food too. He's put on 3 pounds. Looks healthier. Begs me for this wet food. And I had tried Blue Buffalo, purina pro, Rachel Ray, and Wellness CORE. Maybe some are better foods but he doesn't like them. It's nice to have found a food he loves and I feel good giving him.
customer_reviews.author: Marlana

customer_reviews.title: READ THE INGREDIENTS THOROUGHLY BEFORE PURCHASING
customer_reviews.text: I had I had purchased this wet food for my cat but she ended up throwing it up after I went to look at the ingredients and found that there was also chicken inside of this product. It didn’t say that when I had ordered it. Disappointed being that my cat is allergic to chicken beef and any kind of fish. The duck and sweet potato flavor contains chicken.
customer_reviews.author: bethany sheri algarin

customer_reviews.title: Healthy and affordable
customer_reviews.text: Our cat loves this stuff! It's been a while since we switched his canned food brand, and now I am glad we did. Before this one, we have been paying double the price for the same amount. But I can already tell he enjoys this one more. I can't wait to try out some other flavors! Thank you for the giving us (our cat) this healthy diet ingredient meal, for a very affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Oh Family

customer_reviews.title: Something changed.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon is either storing it incorrectly, or something changed with the recipe. I normally feed both my cats chicken/beef/carrot and the turkey spinach. Over the past few weeks both have gradually ate less and less of it while also experiencing some weird trips to the litter box. They only eat their dry food now and completely leave this alone. Looks like I will be shopping for another food.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cat won't even consider eating this food.  And no refund!!
customer_reviews.text: I really want to find a decent, made in USA, healthy cat food for my indoor cat. I've opened two cans of this brand for him and he refuses to even lick the gravy. The stuff smell raunchy too, but, I figured that is my human sense of smell. No, he turns his nose from it too. And when I asked for a return/refund, I find this is not eligible for any refund or return. Other pet food I have tried has been refunded but not this stuff. Do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Great cat food, try it with subscribe and save if you're Amazon Prime!
customer_reviews.text: I like feeding my cat grain free food without spending a whole lot extra money (so I can afford to buy her treats and spoil her rotten) She loves this food too. Purina Beyond grain-free has become my go-to (they have dry food too). The price with subscribe and save (plus the bonus savings from having enough items auto-delivered) make it cheaper than in the store and it just comes to my house automatically. So easy and now I never go to feed her and find an empty shelf (she likes that too). And the subscribe and save program is really easy to manage.
customer_reviews.author: ChristinaTop Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: I won’t be buying again.
customer_reviews.text: Used to have a five star review but had to lower it. My cat used to love this and some flavors are still okay, but others make her vomit a LOT. And not normal vomit, really liquidy and EVERYWHERE. I opened a can today and it looked like little bits of cardboard or thick paper were on the inside rim. All really sketchy.
customer_reviews.author: Doki

customer_reviews.title: Cats hated it
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was giving my cats a nutritious meal, that they would love--or at least like. Neither of them acted like a put anything on their plate, other than trying to cover it up. Unfortunately for me it was a big waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Pony

customer_reviews.title: Dented cans
customer_reviews.text: In my last order, a number of cans were dented. I have had dented cans before (in this brand and also Newman’s), but not near this quantity. It’s happened enough that I no longer want to do subscribe and save for wet cat food.
customer_reviews.author: Kat3299

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous cat food!
customer_reviews.text: My cat scarfs this food down and begs for more. I ordered all the pate flavors and he loves them just as much!! I've owned plenty of cats and never seen any of them dive bomb into their food like this. And the best part:...it doesn't have the fillers and other allergy-causing ingredients of most commercial cat food. Only criticism? I'd like to buy these in larger cans...pretty expensive for such small cans.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: bad food
customer_reviews.text: no problems buying in store so i bought this online and never again made my purbred ragdoll very sick..do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn Biljum

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately the price went up and worst of all
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be a fairly high quality alternative to the grain-free Wellness brand I was feeding my cat previously. Unfortunately the price went up and worst of all, the pH of the food caused my cat to get struvite crystals. I will be switching back to Wellness. If your cat has any urinary problem history, I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: No way
customer_reviews.text: Vet said to try moist,grain-free food for my cat. I have given it to her four times. She will not go near it. She will wait until I feed her dry food later in the day, even though she is hungry. Money lost, but hope humane shelter animals like it.
customer_reviews.author: Kate G.

customer_reviews.title: Unnamed Ingredients
customer_reviews.text: I am not a big fan of unnamed meats, such as "liver" and "fish." However, my cat really likes these and they are otherwise good quality for the price. I only feed the "in gravy" flavors now since I do not like the inclusion of unnamed fish in non-fish flavors. Fish are often full of toxins due to ocean pollutants, and the fish being unnamed makes me extra concerned about the quality. Although the gravy options still include unnamed liver, I can at least avoid unnamed fish. For these reasons, this brand/line do not make up the entirety of my cat's diet, but I add it to his rotation for variety.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: I bought the 12 cans.  My cat LOVED the 8 cans we could use.  Too many damaged.
customer_reviews.text: The cat did love the product. He's diabetic and needs high protein food. Finding a food he really likes and will eat is half the battle, so even if it costs a lot of money it would be worth it. Paying nearly $20 for 12 cans and only being able to use 8 of them because 4 are so badly dented that using them seems "iffy" is not a good use of my money. So, whoever ships them is not doing a great job. For that reason, I won't use Amazon to get the food again. But I'll go into a store, feel the cans and make sure they're intact before I buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Winner
customer_reviews.text: My cats are super excited about this food. It looks much the same as many brands at this price point and in a similar flavor profile, so I couldn't tell you why they like it better, but they do. I will repurchase.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Nice Ingredients Lower "as fed" Phosphorus
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat that has food allergies and also has beginning stage renal failure. Out of all the Purina Beyond canned cat foods, this ingredient Pheasant with Carrots Pate has the lowest "as fed" Phosphorus. It is .44% which is better than some of the other Beyond ingredients canned cat foods. It doesn't seem to bother my cat's food allergies. If it is too strong, mix it with turkey of another lower Phosphorus level cat food. Cat eats it up!
customer_reviews.author: annlw582

customer_reviews.title: My fussy boys like it
customer_reviews.text: My cats get wet food twice a day and graze on dry. I switch up the wet for variety and this is one of their favorites. I split a can between them even though the cans are small because they get other food. They are both a bit fussy and tend to like chicken and turkey best. I've purchased this several times because it's becoming a favorite as well.
customer_reviews.author: lj113

customer_reviews.title: Great, fresh and wonderful smelling food!!
customer_reviews.text: My cat Feets loves it though he seems to prefer the fish varieties. I mix it with a little bone broth to up the fluid intake. When these are opened, they smell “good!” Fresh and very aromatic in a way that sushi is aromatic. We do have to make sure we give him the whole thing within 24 hours, or the food will go bad. Just goes to illustrate its freshness! And there are a ton of varieties!! We also feed him the Purina Wild turkey and Lentil dry food with the raw, freeze dried chicken mixed in. Those are the first to go! He is a bright eyed, soft and healthy cat!
customer_reviews.author: NmTrekker

customer_reviews.title: Scary
customer_reviews.text: Menadione Sodium Bisulfate is a synthetic version of vitamin K and causes cancer in cats. My cats love this food back before I found out. If they would use a heathier Vitamin K I would keep buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Gave my cat explosive watery poops that smelled like a corpse
customer_reviews.author: Rock Star Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Good ingredients, price keeps increasing
customer_reviews.text: What I liked about this food initially was that it had good ingredients, nothing unnecessary, at a good price. But the price is steadily increasing over the past few months. I first bought the pack for $6.92 and it keeps going up from there. I look at the price per ounce for the entire package and this is no longer worth it for the cost. Cats seemed to like it, although I don't have picky eaters.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: Astounding value for price
customer_reviews.text: No idea why, but the duck and sweet potato flavor has been at $8 for 12 cans. I might have gotten this even if I wasn’t trying to meet certain criteria: grain-free and decently low fat content (and a good ratio to protein if possible). And it does meet my standards for these, so why not get some? Within expectation that these weren’t the most enticing (my cat and I just got our first batch of tiki cat; she goes nuts for that), but my cat still prefers it over the free-fed dry cat food. Highly recommend at least trying this flavor out since it’s being priced so attractively.
customer_reviews.author: CeCe

customer_reviews.title: Cats No Longer Like
customer_reviews.text: My cats have stopped eating this brand (Beyond)/flavor completely. I bought several flavors, but same reaction to all. This is after having eaten it happily for several months. Don't know if they simply want a change or something is different about the recipe. I donated the remaining cats to a cat shelter.
customer_reviews.author: S. MatthewsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: My girls' favorite
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of picky eaters (5 and 13) that mostly only like seafood and turkey flavors. My senior kitty has dental problems so she is strictly on wet food now, and it's important for me to keep weight on her. She definitely has an appetite for this flavor! She meows in my face for it every morning. I feel good giving it to her since the ingredients are of decent quality. My younger one is very fond of this flavor too! The plate is always clean.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Great ingredients but my cats don't like it
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 cats and none of them are crazy about this food. I got the Turkey flavor when it was on sale. Well, I know why now... They start eating it but none of them finishes the plate like that happens with other brands so I end up throwing away so much food. Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: M. St Peter

customer_reviews.title: Great for your cat's health
customer_reviews.text: Switched to this product because cats were having issues with other less expensive cat food (loose stools, GI issues). The ingredients are great in this product (no soy fillers, etc). My cats now are very happy and their issues have disappeared. Pay a little extra for quality food and your life as a cat owner will improve!
customer_reviews.author: J. Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Only came with 8 cans
customer_reviews.text: Description states "2 boxes of 12 cans," but I only received one box that contained 8 cans. I paid double the amount I usually pay for a standard 12-can box.
customer_reviews.author: Skurtzy

customer_reviews.title: My Siamese cats luv this Food in all flavors
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 Siamese cats and the one starts nudging or puts her paw on my arm early in the morning, they have been getting wet food twice a day since they were kittens, she will meow when I ask her if she's hungry - And answers every time, I also have had them on the Same Brand of dry food and Both are the picture of Health, I have never had any problems such as vomiting or anything else, I highly recommend this Food in all flavors!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Belle

customer_reviews.title: Finally—grain free food that my cats like!
customer_reviews.text: Beyond is great! We’ve tried many “natural foods” that almost without exception (they will eat some Solid Gold cat food) are left untouched in the bowl. After much wasted food, I thought all they would ever eat was Elegant Medley and Fancy Feast. But we gave Beyond a try hoping that Purina could find a way to make “natural” food tasty too. They did. I’m very glad that so far the cats have liked EVERY flavor of wet and dry food that they tasted so far, knock on wood.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Two cats, one finicky and the other Alley cat
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats, one is a finicky eater, and the other is an Alley cat. I expected the finicky eater to turn his nose up at this food, since it's hard to find food he likes....however my little Alley cat also did not want to eat it. Had to return since either cats won't eat this. I was disappointed since I wanted to give them a better grain free option.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Won't Touch It!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 packages of this "Beyond" brand (ocean white fish pate, wild salmon pate, and tuna in gravy) and my cat refuses to eat them ... she takes one whiff and walks away and cries pitifully. Too bad because the product claims to have healthier ingredients for cats then her usual diet. But, that doesn't matter when your cat won't eat it. I'm asking for a refund on all three packages. I won't order this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: PLN

customer_reviews.title: CAT HAS LOVED THE DIFFERENT FLAVORS FOR SEVERAL MONTHS BUT TODAY....
customer_reviews.text: HE TOOK A FEW BITES AND THREW IT UP. HE WOULD NOT GO BACK TO THE FOOD SO A FEW HOURS LATER i GAVE HIM SOME OTHER CAT FOOD, fANCY fEAST AND HE ATE IT RIGHT UP. THE ONLY THING I NOTICED WITH THIS FOOD WAS I T HAS AN EXTRA STRONG FISH SMELL....i REALLY LOVED GIVING MY CAT THIS FOOD AS IT LOOKED HEALTHY AND INTERESTING AND HE JUST LOVED IT..MORE THAN ANY FOOD i HAVE GIVEN HIM....EXCITED, JUMPING UP FOR IT, LEADING ME TO THE CANS ETC...NOW I DON'T KNOW WHAT TO DO..BUT THIS CAN WAS WASTED MONEY FOR SURE.
customer_reviews.author: viking

customer_reviews.title: Happy Kitty
customer_reviews.text: I have a very picky eater who also has a sensitive tummy. You find something she likes that seems to be good for her tummy trouble so you buy several cans in a variety of flavors and she turns her nose up at it when you give it to her again. This one she hasn't snubbed (yet?), she likes it and it's much better for her in my opinion, having veggies in it as well as her chicken or fish. She hasn't had any issues in her belly.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: I have recommended this product to others and they find similar results
customer_reviews.text: My older cat had problems with his digestive system and did poorly even with high-end cat food. With this food, plus Beyond dry food, the digestion problems disappeared. I have recommended this product to others and they find similar results. My cat and I are very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: June Duffey

customer_reviews.title: Cat refused to eat
customer_reviews.text: Bought it thanks to a big promotion but now I understand why they gave this promotion. My 5 years old cat will not eat it. Tried it for a week. The cat will approach, lick it and then walk again. After a few minutes she will go, smell it and walk a way. 7 days, 7 cans and she will not eat. Either this cat food is too healthy for her and she prefer the usual cheap cat food or the taste is so bad that she prefer to eat the dry food over it.
customer_reviews.author: djairo

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Corky Loves this Food!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had Corky on gluten free dry food and wet food. He's been vomiting a lot and not wanting to eat the GF chicken and/or turkey wet food. I buy Purina and Natural Balance. I accidentally found this duck version at one of the Walmarts where I shop. Corky absolutely is crazy about this food and so far the vomiting has stopped. I just bought 2 cases from Amazon. Also my cat with the allergies enjoys it and I have not noticed and allergic reactions.
customer_reviews.author: Eva Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Favorite for both of my cats!
customer_reviews.text: My cats absolutely LOVE this food. It’s hard to know what they will like - some wet foods they will eat but not very excitedly or completely. I use one can and use half of it watch day for 2 days and when it’s this kind my little boy puts a paw on the counter as soon as he smells it. He’s not allowed up there, but he has to get close for this! They both gobble it up very quickly. Will definitely buy more!
customer_reviews.author: JustJoJo

customer_reviews.title: My Kits walked away!
customer_reviews.text: Smelled good to me, but my Siameseezzs hated it! Next time I will not be so lazy. I will buy one can from the market :-((( They smell it, and then walked away several times, with their nose in the air. One 'LiL Buddy even shakes his front paw...lol...lol. My daughters' dogs will love it !!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cat didn't like this food
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving 3 stars because I think it is a good food for my cat. I can't give it higher rating because this is a review and my kitty is only 2 and not very fussy & snubbed this food-left it in her bowl. She wouldn't eat it even at day's end when she had nothing to eat all day, I put it back in her bowl from the fridge - she refused. I had to mix it with other food so it wouldn't go to waste. I thought it would be a healthy option and I still think it is but my cat just didn't like it.
customer_reviews.author: Jazzin' in Jersey

customer_reviews.title: The cat liked it
customer_reviews.text: Apparently this is too good. I didn’t taste it myself, of course, but I’m informed by the resident connoisseur that it was excellent. So much so, in fact, that plain kibble is now met with quiet contempt and varying degrees of patience are employed until something worthy of her refined palate is placed in her dish. Now if you’ll excuse me, I’m told that the only fitting receptacle for such ambrosia is something in the cut crystal and chased silver line, so I have to go and see if I can order one on Amazon. No, she’s not at all spoiled. Why do you ask?
customer_reviews.author: Asher

customer_reviews.title: My cats LOVE this food!
customer_reviews.text: I began the switch from feeding my cats dry food to wet food, and I read grain-free is the way to go if you want to keep your cats healthy. They LOVE this food! They used to "binge" on their dry kibble, but now that I've incorporated this brand of wet food, they want nothing to do with their dry food and actually savor the wet food when I give it to them twice a day. I feel good knowing my cats are eating a nutritious meal that they actually beg to feed them. Happy kitties make me happy. :)
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Not for picky cats or poultry lovers, gives kitty upset tummy
customer_reviews.text: Yes, I know it is a seafood flavor, but even though my kitty prefers poultry she would still each this. However when she did, it would go straight through her. The Beyond poultry flavors work amazing for her, but the seafood ones make her sick. I do not understand why because she has never had an issue with seafood flavors before. No more of this one. I will stick to poultry flavored Beyond.
customer_reviews.author: Neko

customer_reviews.title: My cat screams bloody murder at me around 5pm every ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat screams bloody murder at me around 5pm every day because he knows it's time for this food. He always cleans his plate. I feed him the dry food as well and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: kitkatwim

customer_reviews.title: Used to be the cats' favorite, now not so much
customer_reviews.text: So, I've order way too many of these damn things because the cats really enjoyed them. At least I thought they did. The last two sets 12, they have left servings half eaten. Completely shocking behavior. I thought maybe I got a funky batch or something (it's not like I'm taste testing them), but they've done the same with the next batch and the shine is officially off. YMMV.
customer_reviews.author: John the Leprechaun

customer_reviews.title: Cats wouldn't eat it
customer_reviews.text: I guess the quality is good, but the cats looked and sniffed and walked away. I know they are finicky as are most cats, but they wouldn't even nibble at this. A waste of money. Back to the other brands and varieties.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: I'll order another flavor next time for variety..
customer_reviews.text: She went for it like a kid going for candy. My old lady, Autumn, (she's the color of Autumn leaves)... . obviously she's a calico with a name like that. She's been eating it for 4 days now and her poo isn't very stinky. I have to wait a bit longer to see if her coat improves but she's happy with this. I don't like to give her a lot of fish so next time I'll give her another flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Blu Belle

customer_reviews.title: The Chicken Is in the Fine Print
customer_reviews.text: I like this brand because it's grain free. However, I should have read the ingredients before I purchased it because my cat could taste a microscopic amount of chicken in a whole sea of fish (and in this formula of food, chicken is the #2 ingredient, so there's a fair bit more in there than "microscopic.") In other words, she hardly ate this. My "three star" rating is for that reason alone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have been buying single cans of this food from ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying single cans of this food from a local store for about 2 months now and since my cat loves it I decided to buy a case. Upon giving her half of a can from this case (the first one I opened) she threw it all up. I thought it was a fluke so I gave her the other half of the can the next day and she threw it all up again. I won't bother feeding her any more from as I no longer trust the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Help, my cats love this.
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this. Unfortunately I have four cats and can't afford these tiny little cans. I bought this for my old cat, and the younger ones steal it from him so I have to sneak it to him in a different room, poor old guy.
customer_reviews.author: Snowflake

customer_reviews.title: My cats (currently) love this food and the price was right
customer_reviews.text: Our cats are finicky. Maybe most are. They change their mind frequently, but right now, this is the top of their most desired list. The ingredients are good, so that makes me happy. As long as it's a healthy choice, I'm good with that.
customer_reviews.author: JeriMac

customer_reviews.title: Spinach? My cat says "No Thank You!" to the spinach.
customer_reviews.text: What cat eats SPINACH as a choice?! my cat won't eat the Ocean Whitefish with Spinach recipe of the Purina Beyond Grain Free Pate Wet Cat Food. However, my 9+ year old spoiled baby LOVES the Purina Beyond Grain Free Salmon pate AND the Trout and Catfish pate. He doesn't like and won't eat any of the beef flavors. Most other brands of wet cat food he has vomited up, but not this. He had 3 teeth removed so I was looking for a wet food for him.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Bad batch, cat has been throwing up after eating every time.
customer_reviews.text: I get the salmon pate cans delivered as a subscription every month and noticed the May one has been causing my cat to throw up all the time. She threw up three times in one day after eating only half of a can, so I can only assume the batch I got was very poor quality. She's been eating this brand of wet food for more than a year, so I wonder if Purina changed something in its recipe recently or if they didn't do quality control well enough before the cans are shipped out. Either way, I am stopping my subscription to be on the safer side.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: They Loved It, Then Hated It!
customer_reviews.text: The first time I ordered this and fed it to my cats, they ate it ravenously, as if they hadn't eaten for days, and as if it was the Most Delicious Food EVER! Second order, after I spent the money on something I thought they loved, they turned up their snooty little noses at it and won't eat it. Very aggravated by them!! So, sad to say, won't be ordering it again.
customer_reviews.author: CatMother Linda

customer_reviews.title: Not for my non-picky eater
customer_reviews.text: Our cat eats pretty much anything but he did not eat this. We tried all three flavors several times. He wouldn't even lick the gravy. Spoiled? Tasteless? Bad taste? Your guess is as good as mine. Gave it away.
customer_reviews.author: kathinthegarden

customer_reviews.title: A godsend for sensitive cats
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been hesitant after reading the reviews about some of the ingredients but with my cat this saved her. She has horrible food allergies and asthma so giving her dry food wasn’t an option. I’ve tried so many different things, gently transitioning her from one food to the next to find ANYTHING that didn’t set off her allergies or make her throw up. Since I started her on this she has only thrown up the first day when starting the transition, and she’s been better ever since. She’s more energetic, her coat is in better shape, and she’s finally being more interactive and not hiding somewhere throwing up or trying to hack up a lung.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee Ogburn

customer_reviews.title: Something in this food is causing my cats to throw up!!
customer_reviews.text: I tried to alternate this food and Weruva brand and I noticed when I stopped giving this Purina brand, my cats would not throw up. The gravy may have garlic or onion which are toxic ingredients to cats. I'm not sure what it has. I have also stopped Purina Fancy Feast because of the same issue. I thought the Beyond grain free would be different but apparently not.
customer_reviews.author: Rowena P.

customer_reviews.title: No Cats Ever Eat The Chunks
customer_reviews.text: Healthy cat food. Good price on Amazon, as compared to grocery store. But my cats usually only lick the gravy and leave the chunks. The only way they eat the chunks is if I leave the food out all day and give them nothing else. But I don’t like forcing them like that. I want them to enjoy their food. This grain free food is WAY better in the pate version. The cats scarf it up in pate!
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Is this a new recipe? My cat hates it now!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what’s up... my cat has loved this product in the past.... just got a new delivery from amazon and he won’t touch the stuff.. Did they change the recipe? I have 36 cans of this and after 5 days... he won’t touch it...hope I can send back the unopened 2 twelve packs
customer_reviews.author: BR

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this food. I thought the cans were larger, so I use one of these small cans just for one serving for 2 cats. I also mix it with dry food though. Otherwise it would barely feed 1 cat. Other than that, it’s good!
customer_reviews.author: 1mjslove

customer_reviews.title: Rotten can
customer_reviews.text: There was one broken can. I’m sure it was broken before shipment because the package was rotten. The whole kitchen smelled written. This will not be so bad if it wasn’t broken for at least few days. I ordered the item just last night.
customer_reviews.author: Zara

customer_reviews.title: Scary
customer_reviews.text: Menadione Sodium Bisulfate is a synthetic version of vitamin K and causes cancer in cats. My cats love this food back before I found out. If they would use a heathier Vitamin K I would keep buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I believe this has made my cat throw up even with prescription food
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because i thought this was a deal and i thought it was of good quality however i noticed all 3 days of feeding my cat with it he has puked it up so because he has enough problems with cat food i do have to conclude it is this food and also because of the color. I wouldn't be able to recommend it and will have to buy new wet cat food. What a waste!
customer_reviews.author: kelli

customer_reviews.title: No carrageenan :)
customer_reviews.text: Good ingredients and no carrageenan...if it's bad for me, it's bad for my little buddies! I looked at Newmans Own and Nutrish also but they include carrageenan in their recipe. Cats are excited about their moist breakfast :)
customer_reviews.author: KLBRN

customer_reviews.title: Great quality food
customer_reviews.text: This is great quality cat food. I do a lot of research to make sure I buy quality good for my cat, and this cat good is highly rated and make of quality ingredients. I like that the flavors provide variety. My cat loves this flavor and this cat food in general.
customer_reviews.author: Jane P

customer_reviews.title: not real food, cat won't eat it!
customer_reviews.text: must be terribly poor quality if my cat wont eat it. looks pale. EDIT: The last can I attempted was accidentally left out for a few days while away - but it didn't go bad like real meat or food would, it just kinda dried over like paste. No scent. (Not real food!)
customer_reviews.author: DayaB

customer_reviews.title: No fishy smell, decent price, grain free
customer_reviews.text: Not my cats’ favorite food but this is nice because it is natural and grain free at a decent price without smelling strongly of fish or meat. Don’t know why there are veggies in the recipe — do cats need to eat carrots? Or are they just for coloring? The chunky texture is nice and easy to scoop/serve. Doesn’t leave residue on the bowl like pate. Easy for kitties to pick up and chew.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: My cat won't eat any of them.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try this food to see if my little guy would eat something healthier for him since he's been gaining weight. Well, I have to say I was disappointed, because all he does is sniff it and walk away. I even removed his dry food overnight and in the morning this canned food was still in his bowl. He never, ever goes all night without eating something, but he refuses to eat any of these three varieties. It was a waste of money and I won't make that mistake again.
customer_reviews.author: FlaFossil

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I have been feeding my cats Purina Grain Free wet pate cat food for several years now, since one of my older cats got diabetes and died. I am convinced her diabetes was a result of eating cat food that was not made from healthy ingredients. I have also spent good money on expensive brands that my cats would not touch. This seems to have all the right ingredients, ...AND... they love eating it!
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn Girl

customer_reviews.title: Another winner my cat loves to eat!
customer_reviews.text: I have been feeding my cats Purina Grain Free wet pate cat food for several years now, since one of my older cats got diabetes and died. I am convinced her diabetes was a result of eating cat food that was not made from healthy ingredients. I have also spent good money on expensive brands that my cats would not touch. This seems to have all the right ingredients, ...AND... they love eating it!
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn Girl

customer_reviews.title: Expensive and my cats disliked it.
customer_reviews.text: One of my cats was having digestive problems and my vet recommended trying a higher protein wet food. I checked around and decided to give this a shot. My cats disliked this food with a passion usually reserved for politicians and telemarketers. It would sit in the bowl all day until I threw it away. They are usually not very picky eaters. I had also tried the chicken and sweet potato one on them and it didn't go much better. Maybe my cats are carb lovers, I don't know.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cat liked a couple of cans. I really need to get a variety. The ingrediants are fantastic
customer_reviews.text: My cat wouldn't eat it. Gave it to my son his cat didn't like it either. I don't want to say bad things. Cats know what they like...mine doesn't like this. I liked the ingredients. It's good.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: None of my cats will eat it
customer_reviews.text: Tried because of ingredients and price. My cats WILL NOT touch it. Gave to my sister's cat....he won't eat either. Donated to local shelter, I hope some cat will like it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Review of Purina Beyond Grain Free, Natural Adult Wet Cat Food
customer_reviews.text: We have an older cat that thrives on this cat food. That is important since she has some dental problems. Good choice for adult cats especially since it is such a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene H. Woods

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many no grain foods and found this one to be the one my cats prefer for taste. One suffers from IBD and Beyond is the ONLY food out of at least 20 different grain free brands both wet and dry she can eat to manage her situation. Not all Beyond products are grain free so if that is a must - read the label carefully. Very satisfied with the quality and results from feeding my cats this food.
customer_reviews.author: sedonacotton

customer_reviews.title: Mom didn’t Like
customer_reviews.text: I put a dish of cat food on the counter while multitasking other chores - My elderly mother noticed what look like something yummy on the counter, and decided to take a bite. She asked me later, “What was that food on the counter? It was the worst tasting thing I ever ate! Lol The cat didn’t like it either.
customer_reviews.author: Starraven

customer_reviews.title: My pikcy cats loved this
customer_reviews.text: Got as a replacement for their usual brand - they loved this one - small cans just right for one meal - love the quality and the cats loved the taste!
customer_reviews.author: lovemyboys

customer_reviews.title: Meow Meow Meow Meow Meow Meow Meow
customer_reviews.text: This is the only grain-free food I truly enjoy. Five starz!
customer_reviews.author: Child

customer_reviews.title: Nice-Sized Chunks of Fish and Carrots
customer_reviews.text: My three kitty's LOVE this food! It has smaller-sized chunks of fish and carrots in a light gravy. A 3-ounce can gives each kitty an ounce per meal which is enough to keep their belly's happy and not over-stuffed. 😃 Adding a little extra water helps them eat slower and stay hydrated, too! ~Four Paws Up~
customer_reviews.author: Mamakathy1966

product_meta.title: Purina Beyond Grain Free, Natural, Adult Wet Cat Food
product_meta.description: Color:Quail & Carrot Pate| Size:(12) 3 oz. CansTend to your cat's nutritional needs while giving her a grain-free solution when you serve her Purina Beyond Grain Free Pate Quail & Carrot Recipe adult wet cat food. Quail is the #1 ingredient in this recipe, which is made with real, recognizable ingredients you know and trust, including wholesome vegetable accents. Each ingredient is purposely selected, and when working together, they help your cat live a long, healthy life with you. We formulate this recipe without artificial colors, flavors or preservatives, so she gets the nourishment she needs and nothing she doesn't. The smooth pate texture is easy for your cat to manage, helping to enrich her mealtime experience, and the high-quality ingredients let you feel good about what goes into her meals. Offer her this Purina Beyond adult cat food recipe, and give her a natural cat food you can trust. Don't keep her waiting when it's time for dinner. Get your order of Purina Beyond adult wet cat food quick from Amazon.com.
feature_bullets: Twelve (12) 3 Oz. Can - Purina Beyond Grain Free Quail & Carrot Recipe Adult Wet Cat Food
Grain-Free Solution You Want For Your Cat
Made Without Corn, Wheat Or Soy
